sentence.Network_en: In starting a new company, many hurdles must be crossed.
sentence.Network_cn: 刚开办一个公司时, 必须克服许多障碍.

sentence.Network_en: Davis won the 400m. hurdles in a new Olympic time of 49.3 sec.
sentence.Network_cn: 戴维斯以49.3秒的成绩刷新奥运会纪录，在400米跨栏赛跑中一举夺冠。

sentence.Network_en: There are several hurdles to be got over in this project.
sentence.Network_cn: 在这项工程中有一些困难要克服.

entry.def: A hurdle is a problem, difficulty, or part of a process that may prevent you from achieving something.

example.ex: Two-thirds of candidates fail at this first hurdle and are packed off home...
example.tran: 三分之二的候选人在第一个难关就败下阵来，只好打包回家了。

example.ex: The weather will be the biggest hurdle so I have to be ready.
example.tran: 天气将会是最大的障碍，所以我必须要作好准备。

entry.def: Hurdles is a race in which people have to jump over a number of obstacles that are also called hurdles. You can use hurdles to refer to one or more races.

example.ex: Davis won the 400m. hurdles in a new Olympic time of 49.3 sec.
example.tran: 戴维斯以49.3秒的成绩刷新奥运会纪录，在400米跨栏赛跑中一举夺冠。

entry.def: If you hurdle, you jump over something while you are running.

example.ex: He crossed the lawn and hurdled the short fence...
example.tran: 他跑过草地，跳过低矮的栅栏。

example.ex: She learnt to hurdle by leaping over bales of hay on her family's farm.
example.tran: 她通过在自家农场里跳跨干草捆学会了跨栏。

means.word_mean: 1. a footrace in which contestant must negotiate a series of hurdles
